NAME: Name
OVERVIEW.MCADDR.LABEL: Material Companion Address
OVERVIEW.MCADDR.TOOLTIP: Material Companion address to use in Foundry.
OVERVIEW.REMOTEMCADDR.LABEL: Alternative Material Companion Address
OVERVIEW.REMOTEMCADDR.TOOLTIP: You can use this address instead of 'Material Companion Address'. Should only be necessary if Material Companion is not on the same machine as the Foundry client. This will only work for unsecured Foundry servers.
OVERVIEW.CONNSTATUS.LABEL: Connection Status
OVERVIEW.CONNSTATUS.TOOLTIP: The connection status of each supported module and its corresponding device (Material Plane sensor, Stream Deck, etc) is displayed, where ✔ indicates a connection and ✘ indicates no connection.
MP.UPDATE.LABEL: Update
MP.SELECT_VERSION.LABEL: Firmware Version
MP.SELECT_VERSION.TOOLTIP: Select the firmware version to program.
MP.SELECT_WS_VERSION.LABEL: Webserver Version
MP.SELECT_WS_VERSION.TOOLTIP: Select the webserver version to program.
MP.FILE.LABEL: File
MP.MODULE_CONNECTED.LABEL: Material Plane Connected
MP.MODULE_CONNECTED.TOOLTIP: Displays whether the Material Plane module is connected to Material Companion.
MP.SENSOR_CONNECTED.LABEL: Material Plane Sensor Connected
MP.SENSOR_CONNECTED.TOOLTIP: Displays whether the Material Plane sensor is connected to Material Companion.
MP.CONNECT_USB.LABEL: Connect through USB
MP.CONNECT_USB.TOOLTIP: Enable the Material Plane sensor to connect to Material Companion through USB.
MP.SENSOR_USB.LABEL: Sensor USB Port
MP.SENSOR_USB.TOOLTIP: Select the USB port the sensor is connected to. Press to refresh the ports.
MP.SENSOR_VARIANT.LABEL: Variant
MP.SENSOR_FIRMWARE.LABEL: Firmware
MP.SENSOR_WEBSERVER.LABEL: Webserver
MP.SENSOR_WIFICONNECTED.LABEL: WiFi Connected
MP.SENSOR_WIFICONNECTED.TOOLTIP: Checked if the sensor is connected to WiFi
MP.SENSOR_SSID.LABEL: SSID
MP.SENSOR_SSID.TOOLTIP: Name of the WiFi station the sensor is connected to.
MP.SENSOR_IP.LABEL: IP Address
MP.SENSOR_WEBSERVERLINK.LABEL: Webserver Address
MP.SENSOR_READ.LABEL: Read Configuration
MP.SENSOR_READ.TOOLTIP: Read the configuration from the sensor.
MP.SENSOR_CONNECT.LABEL: Connect to WiFi Access Point
MP.SENSOR_CONNECT_POPUP.CONTENT:
Connect to WiFi Access Point

Scan for access points the sensor can detect.
After selecting the access point you want the sensor to connect to, enter the password, and click "Connect".
Alternatively, you can enter the SSID (network name) manually.
MP.SENSOR_CONNECT_POPUP.SCAN_ACCESSPOINT: Scan for nearby access points. This can take a few seconds.
MP.SENSOR_CONNECT_POPUP.SSID.LABEL: SSID
MP.SENSOR_CONNECT_POPUP.SSID.TOOLTIP: SSID of the access point to connect to.
MP.SENSOR_CONNECT_POPUP.PASSWORD.LABEL: Password
MP.SENSOR_CONNECT_POPUP.PASSWORD.TOOLTIP: Password of the access point to connect to.
MP.SENSOR_UPDATE.DONE:
Update successful.
Restart the sensor using the 'Reset' button.
MP.SENSOR_UPDATE.ERR_UPDATEMODE:
To update the sensor, you must boot it in 'update mode':
  1. Press and hold the 'Boot' button on the sensor
  2. Press the 'Reset' button on the sensor for 1 second
  3. Release the 'Boot' button
  4. Rescan the USB ports and select the 'Sensor - Update' option
MP.SENSOR_UPDATE.ERR_FILE:
Could not find firmware/webserver file.

Make sure you're connected to the internet and that you have selected the correct sensor variant and a firmware/webserver version that is compatible with your sensor variant.
MP.SENSOR_UPDATE.ERR_CONN: Failed to connect to the sensor. Make sure you've selected the correct COM port and sensor variant. See 'Details' for more info.
MP.SENSOR_UPDATE.ERR: Update failed, see 'Details' for more info
MP.DOCK_USB.LABEL: Dock USB Port
MP.DOCK_USB.TOOLTIP: Select the USB port the dock is connected to. Press to refresh the ports.
MP.BASE_FIRMWARE.LABEL: Firmware
MP.BASE_ID.LABEL: Id
MP.BASE_SENSITIVITY.LABEL: Touch Sensitivity
MP.BASE_SENSITIVITY.TOOLTIP: Touch sensitivity of the base, higher means higher sensitivity. Higher sensitivity can lead to false triggers.
MP.BASE_READ_WRITE_RESET.LABEL: Read/Write/Reset
MP.BASE_READ_WRITE_RESET.TOOLTIP: Read the configuration from the base, write new configuration to the base or reset the configuration.
MP.BASE_UPDATE.ERR_CONN: Could not connect to COM port
MP.PEN_FIRMWARE.LABEL: Firmware
MP.PEN_ID.LABEL: Id
MP.PEN.TIMEOUT.LABEL: Timeout (s)
MP.PEN.TIMEOUT.TOOLTIP: Time in seconds the pen will stay on after releasing all buttons.
MP.PEN_READ_WRITE_RESET.LABEL: Read/Write/Reset
MP.PEN_READ_WRITE_RESET.TOOLTIP: Read the configuration from the pen, write new configuration to the pen or reset the configuration.
MK.MODULECONNECTED.LABEL: Material Keys Connected
MK.MODULECONNECTED.TOOLTIP: Displays whether the Material Keys module is connected to Material Companion.
MK.LPCONNECTED.LABEL: Launchpad Connected
MK.LPCONNECTED.TOOLTIP: Displays whether a Launchpad is connected to Material Companion.
MK.MIDIDEVICES.LABEL: MIDI Devices
MK.MIDIDEVICES.TOOLTIP: List of available MIDI inputs and outputs. Orange in/outputs are compatible with Material Keys. Green in/outputs are currently connected to Material Companion. Red in/outputs are blocked and will not try to connect. Click an in/output to block or unblock it.
MK.SCAN_MIDI.LABEL: Scan for MIDI Devices
MK.SCAN_MIDI.TOOLTIP: Scan for MIDI devices connected to the computer.
MD.MODULECONNECTED.LABEL: Material Deck Connected
MD.MODULECONNECTED.TOOLTIP: Displays whether the Material Deck module is connected to Material Companion.
MD.SDCONNECTED.LABEL: Stream Deck Application Connected
MD.SD_NOT_CONNECTED.LABEL: SD Application Not Connected
MD.SDCONNECTED.TOOLTIP: Displays whether the Stream Deck application is connected to Material Companion.
MD.DEVICES.LABEL: Connected Stream Decks
MD.DEVICE_NAME.LABEL: Name
MD.DEVICE_NAME.TOOLTIP: Name of the Stream Deck as configured in the Stream Deck application.
MD.DEVICE_TYPE.LABEL: Type
MD.DEVICE_TYPE.TOOLTIP: Device type (Stream Deck, Stream Deck XL, etc).
MD.CLIENTS.LABEL: Connected Foundry Clients
MD.CLIENTS.TOOLTIP: List of connected Foundry Clients with Material Deck enabled.
MD.USERNAME.LABEL: Username
MD.CONNECT_TO.LABEL: Connect To
MD.CONNECT_TO.TOOLTIP: Displays all Stream Decks and whether they connect to the client (green) or not (red). Click on the devices to enable or disable the connection.
SETTINGS.LANGUAGE.LABEL: Language
SETTINGS.LANGUAGE.TOOLTIP: Sets the language of Material Server.
SETTINGS.RUNINTRAY.LABEL: Run in tray
SETTINGS.RUNINTRAY.TOOLTIP: Run the application in the tray.
SETTINGS.WEBSOCKETPORT.LABEL: Websocket port
SETTINGS.WEBSOCKETPORT.TOOLTIP: Sets the websocket port for Foundry to listen to. Changing this will require you to reconfigure the 'Material Companion Address' in the module settings to reflect the change.
SETTINGS.DEFAULTS.LABEL: Reset settings
SETTINGS.DEFAULTS.TOOLTIP: Reset all settings to their default values. Will restart Material Companion.
SETTINGS.RESET.CONFIRM: Are you sure you want to reset all settings?
SETTINGS.SAVE.LABEL: Save Settings
SETTINGS.SAVE.TOOLTIP: Save the settings on this page. Will restart Material Companion.
